lines.text: [final line of the last-ever episode]
Have I locked the door?
[the boys are climbing a hill that provides a spectacular view of the surrounding countryside]

Every time I come up here, the spirit soars! You can't help thinking what a wonderful place it would be to set up a machine gun! Give me a small squad of hand-picked men and I could defend this place indefinitely!
How long have you been a nature lover, Foggy?
[Foggy is trying to get Howard in shape by leaping small walls]
It's people like you who make this country so rich in idiots.
to Glenda, when she asks a naive question]
Drink your coffee.
I bet they think we're up to something.
The thought does cross your mind.
I want you to know. I'd never do anything to compromise your reputation.
Not on a bicycle. I can see that.

[angily]
What are *you* doing, peering round corners?
Sssssh. Not so loud. There's a man assaulting a woman.

[terrified]
Where? Do something about it!
I can't.
Why ever not?

[cheekily]
He's not started yet!
[Compo tries to grope Nora]
[Compo has just hugged Nora Batty]
Doesn't tha feel anything?

[puzzled]
Like what?
Attraction. Physical attraction.
Nora, tell me. What does tha see?
[Compo parades in front of Nora]
I see you've got another hole in them trousers.
You *do* realise you'll be representing your country.
No problem.
We haven't been at war with France for ages. I suppose it had to end some time.
I was always saved from something serious by my tendency to giggle.
I must warn you - I'm only available for the next twenty-four hours.
[Nora Batty gives Compo a clip round the ear]

[indignantly]
What was that for?
That's before you start.
Eh, you're a bit touchy this morning.

[cheekily]
Why don't you take a day off?

[icily]
Why don't you take one on.
[Compo has just died]
Are we going to see him?
I can see him, fooling about, hands in his pockets, dragging his wellies.
Are we going to see him before they close the lid.
Oh, I'm not so sure about that.
You'll be sorry. Besides, how often do you get to see something for nothing these days?
[at Compo's funeral, as "The Last Post" plays in the background, Clegg releases a pigeon called Gladys, with a harmonica strapped to its wings, in memory of Compo]
Mind how you go, Gladys. Best of luck from all us pigeons.
You don't think I've *always* been a grasping old woman.
[talking about Howard]
He's in search of the silent bicycle. It's when they're quiet you know they're up to something.
Wesley! Get yerself in here!
Anyway, you're allowed to be stupid at seventeen.
You were never seventeen. You were forty when you were born.

[paranoid]
I must have enemies.

[ominously]
There's me, for a start.
Do you know what I like about this? Very little.
[Wally can't pronounce the letter R]
I'm wready. Yes, I'm wready.
There was anger. I've got more personality now.
I keep acting like someone who's trying to hide a woman in the house.
I only joined to do Robin Hood.

[to Marina]
I'd love us to stop and just explore more.
You can't just go digging in like a lunatic with that screwdriver.
Well pass me something sharper - like your tongue!

[plaintively]
I've neglected her.
Sounds reasonable to me. If *I* had Nora Batty, *I'd* neglect her too.
Are you sure it's safe, Howard?
I wouldn't bring you anywhere where you weren't safe, love.
Well, you needn't go as far as that.
Norm, does tha think me magnetism could be slipping?
Don't ask me. I was a total failure at romance.
But you were married.
That's what did it!
Now you wait here. It's not only me City and Guilds, it's the social chasm between us.
Hey, shurrup! Give us a fag and I'll give you a sniff of me socks!
It's just an ordinary dart.
It's not an ordinary dart. It's very far from being an ordinary dart. I've prepared it with something to make the creature sleep. Don't worry - I've seen the natives do this in the jungle.
Yeah, but they've got poisons growing in the jungle. What have you got?
The trained soldier learns to make do with whatever's available. You have to use whatever comes to hand.
All right. What is it tha soaks the darts in that's gonna put it to sleep.
Well, if you must know, it's Horlicks.
Why d'you think it is they won't let me go?
You've *been* shot at. Now it's somebody else's turn.
It's because they're ashamed of me. Because I'm scruffy.
I wouldn't say "scruffy". Would you say "scruffy"?
Yes, I'd say "scruffy".
Life's easier when the light of passion goes out.
When did yours go out?
Oh, I must have been all of twenty-three.
